bollywood.span: Rocky, a young man, seeks power and wealth in order to fulfil a promise to his dying mother. His quest takes him to Mumbai, where he gets involved with the notorious gold mafia.
A labourer named Pushpa makes enemies as he rises in the world of red sandalwood smuggling. However, violence erupts when the police attempt to bring down his illegal business.

In college, Farhan and Raju form a great bond with Rancho due to his refreshing outlook. Years later, a bet gives them a chance to look for their long-lost friend whose existence seems rather elusive.
M S Dhoni, a boy from Ranchi, aspires to play cricket for India. Though he initially tries to please his father by working for the Indian Railways, he ultimately decides to chase his dreams.

Vikram Vedha is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language neo-noir action thriller film written-directed by Pushkar–Gayathri, based on their 2017 Tamil film of the same name and also inspired by the Indian folktale Baital Pachisi.
After reading the letter her mother had written for her before she died, Anjali decides to bring together her widowed father, Rahul, with his true love who is also named Anjali.
Friends Kabir, Imran and Arjun take a vacation in Spain before Kabir's marriage. The trip turns into an opportunity to mend fences, heal wounds, fall in love with life and combat their worst fears
When the disappearance of a policewoman's son threatens to ruin Vijay's family, he leaves no stone unturned in order to shield his family.
Mahavir Singh Phogat, a former wrestler, decides to fulfil his dream of winning a gold medal for his country by training his daughters for the Commonwealth Games despite the existing social stigmas
An innocent alien lands on Earth but loses his communication device. He meets Jaggu, a heartbroken reporter, and tries to find his device. With time, he raises many thought-provoking questions.

Ishaan is criticised by his parents for his poor academic performance and is sent away to a boarding school. Ram, an art teacher, however, realises he has dyslexia and helps him uncover his potential.

technology.h3: Boston Dynamics leads call to stop arming robots – will anyone listen?
technology.span: A group of robot-makers led by Boston Dynamics has pledged to push back on any attempts to add weapons to their creations, but other companies will continue to arm their robots and market them to police and military buyers

technology.h3: Meta’s text-to-audio AI can create common sounds and generate music
technology.span: Meta’s AudioGen text-to-audio artificial intelligence model could create sound for video games, film soundtracks or music production

technology.h3: Nutrient-measuring device could make microwaves that count calories
technology.span: Scientists have found a way to use leaked electromagnetic radiation to measure nutrients in microwaved meals

technology.h3: Sci-fi author Neal Stephenson wants to build a metaverse open to all
technology.span: The science-fiction author who coined the term metaverse in his 1992 novel Snow Crash is going head-to-head with Meta and Microsoft to create an open-source platform for creating virtual worlds

technology.h3: Who should own the copyright on AI-generated artwork?
technology.span: Artificial intelligences can create images inspired by the human-generated art they train on. This is raising concerns over copyright and artists’ livelihoods

technology.h3: Ethereum Merge: What will the radical update mean for cryptocurrency?
technology.span: The electricity consumption of the Ethereum cryptocurrency rivals that of some countries, but a controversial update to how it works will slash this by 99 per cent – here's the low-down on what's going on

technology.h3: Apps used as alternatives to prison in US found to have privacy flaws
technology.span: An analysis of 16 apps used as alternatives to incarceration found numerous privacy problems including in an app used to track almost 248,000 immigrants

technology.h3: Tory leadership contest's online vote is still vulnerable to hackers
technology.span: Hacking concerns continue to dog the online Conservative party vote, which will decide next UK prime minister – should online voting even be used in such situations?

technology.h3: Big Tech and Civil War enthusiasts clash over historic US battlefields
technology.span: Northern Virginia is home to many American Civil War battlefield sites as well as the largest concentration of data centres in the world. Plans for more data centres are now pitting preservationists and big technology companies against each other

technology.h3: People trust AI to make big decisions – as long as a human checks them
technology.span: Artificial intelligences are increasingly making important decisions that affect our lives, but people consider the calls made to be fairer and more acceptable if a human is in the loop too

technology.h3: Emissions from mining a single bitcoin have increased 126-fold
technology.span: Between 2016 and 2021, the carbon emissions associated with mining bitcoin have increased from 0.9 tonnes to 113 tonnes per coin

technology.h3: Computer made from swirly magnets can recognise handwritten digits
technology.span: A prototype computer built using a magnetic material called a skyrmion has been programmed to recognise handwritten digits. The approach could be particularly energy-efficient

technology.article-content: Philosophy of technology is a branch of philosophy that studies the practice of designing and creating artifacts, and the nature of the things so created. It emerged as a discipline over the past two centuries, and has grown considerably since the 1970s. The humanities philosophy of technology is concerned with the meaning of technology for, and its impact on, society and culture. Initially, technology was seen as an extension of the human organism that replicated or amplified bodily and mental faculties. Marx framed it as a tool used by capitalists to oppress the proletariat, but believe technology would be a fundamentally liberating force once it was freed from societal deformations.Second-wave philosophers like Ortega later shifted their focus from economics and politics to  life and living in a techno-material culture, arguing that technology could oppress even the bourgeoisie who were its ostensible masters and protectors. Third-stage philosophers like Don Ihde and Albert Borgmann represent a turn toward de-generalization and empiricism, and considered how humans can learn to live with technology.
